items.name: Oil Lantern
items.description: A brass oil lantern, well-worn but functional.
items.examineText: A reliable brass lantern. Essential for exploring dark caves. The brass is worn smooth from years of use.

items.name: Uncle Cornelius's Journal
items.description: A leather-bound journal filled with cryptic notes.
items.examineText: The handwriting is barely legible. There are sketches of cave formations, strange symbols, and references to 'the Spanish treasure.'

items.name: New Hemp Rope
items.description: A coil of sturdy new rope.
items.examineText: Strong and reliable. About fifty feet of good hemp rope. Should hold a person's weight easily.

items.name: Candle
items.description: A simple tallow candle.
items.examineText: A basic tallow candle. It'll last maybe an hour. Better than nothing in the dark.

items.name: Lit Candle
items.description: A burning candle, casting a small circle of light.
items.examineText: The flame dances in the darkness. Won't last forever.

items.name: Box of Matches
items.description: A small box of sulfur matches.
items.examineText: About a dozen matches left. Keep them dry.

items.name: Rock Hammer
items.description: A small geologist's hammer.
items.examineText: A proper rock hammer for collecting specimens. The head is made of good steel.

items.name: Magnifying Glass
items.description: A brass-rimmed magnifying glass.
items.examineText: Useful for examining small details. The lens is high quality - probably came from an expensive set.

items.name: Silver Dollar
items.description: A Morgan silver dollar, 1889 mint.
items.examineText: Fresh from the mint this year. Lady Liberty stares out from the face. Worth exactly what it says.

items.name: Blank Mining Permit
items.description: An official-looking blank permit form.
items.examineText: The Stone County seal is pre-printed. It just needs to be filled out and stamped.

items.name: County Wax Seal Stamp
items.description: An official wax seal stamp.
items.examineText: The Stone County seal. How this ended up here is another question entirely.

items.name: Mining Permit (Forged)
items.description: A completed mining permit. Looks official enough.
items.examineText: The forgery is passable. Let's hope no one looks too closely.

items.name: Jar of Bat Guano
items.description: A jar filled with... well, bat droppings.
items.examineText: Disgusting, but valuable. This stuff was worth $700 a ton to the mining company. Full of nitrates.

items.name: Orange Calcite Sample
items.description: A beautiful chunk of orange calcite crystal.
items.examineText: The color is remarkable - like frozen fire. This came from the Spring Room, where the walls glow orange.

items.name: Torn Journal Page
items.description: A page torn from Uncle Cornelius's journal.
items.examineText: 'The Spanish left more than a ladder. Follow the water to find what they buried. The Liberty Bell knows the way.'

items.name: Burned Journal Page
items.description: A partially burned page from the journal.
items.examineText: Most of the text is destroyed. Only a few words survive: '...the real swindle... marble... worth more than gold...'

items.name: Water-Damaged Journal Page
items.description: A water-stained page from the journal.
items.examineText: The ink has run but some is readable: 'Lynch doesn't know what he bought. Neither did Powell. But I do.'

items.name: Mining Helmet
items.description: A leather mining helmet with a candle holder.
items.examineText: A proper miner's cap. The leather is stiff but functional. The candle holder is built right in.

items.name: Ore Cart Wheel
items.description: A heavy iron wheel from a mining cart.
items.examineText: Cast iron, meant for the narrow gauge tracks in the mine. Heavy but well-balanced.

items.name: Bag of Counterweight Rocks
items.description: A burlap sack filled with heavy rocks.
items.examineText: Limestone chunks. Heavy enough to balance something on a pulley system.
